prompt:
Please search for and recommend the top 5 job opportunities for a Software Engineer with the following criteria:

- Location: Remote or San Francisco Bay Area
- Experience Level: Senior (5-10 years)
- Tech Stack: Python, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS
- Industry: Technology, SaaS
- Company Size: Startup to mid-size (50-500 employees)

For each job, please provide:
1. Company name
2. Job title
3. Location
4. Key requirements
5. Why this might be a good fit

Please format the results in a clear, easy-to-read structure.
job_results:
Here are 5 strong matches based on your criteria (remote/SF Bay, senior, Python/Docker/K8s/AWS, SaaS/tech, ~50–500 employees). Always check each posting for the latest details before applying.

---

## 1) Archera – Senior Software Engineer (Backend)

**Location**  
- Remote – USA/Canada ([job-boards.greenhouse.io](https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/archera/jobs/4937570008?utm_source=openai))  

**Key Requirements (highlights)** ([job-boards.greenhouse.io](https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/archera/jobs/4937570008?utm_source=openai))  
- 5+ years professional software development experience.  
- Strong Python and SQL; API/ETL development.  
- Experience with relational DBs and data warehouses (PostgreSQL, Snowflake).  
- SaaS application experience on AWS/Azure/GCP.  
- Familiarity with containerized environments and CI/CD.  
- Startup / high-growth environment experience and ability to lead projects end‑to‑end.  

**Why this might be a good fit**  
- Direct match on Python + cloud + containers; you also get exposure to data warehousing and cost-optimization SaaS.  
- Fully remote across US/Canada, good if you want flexibility but still want to work on serious infra/data problems.  
- Early- to mid-stage SaaS company (fits the 50–500 range) working heavily in cloud optimization and automation.

---

## 2) Alembic – Senior Backend Engineer

**Location**  
- San Francisco, CA (onsite or hybrid; ~43 employees) ([builtin.com](https://builtin.com/job/senior-backend-engineer/7316033?utm_source=openai))  

**Key Requirements (highlights)** ([builtin.com](https://builtin.com/job/senior-backend-engineer/7316033?utm_source=openai))  
- Senior backend role at an early-stage analytics startup (AI-powered marketing analytics).  
- Stack includes: Python, FastAPI/Flask, Postgres, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Terraform, plus CI/CD and Elasticsearch.  
- Building and scaling backend services and data infrastructure for real‑time analytics.  

**Why this might be a good fit**  
- Very strong alignment with your tech stack: Python, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS are explicitly called out.  
- SF-based startup of ~40 people squarely in the “startup to mid-size” band.  
- Product is SaaS analytics, so it hits the tech/SaaS industry preference while giving you interesting performance and data‑intensive backend challenges.

---

## 3) Milo – Senior Backend Engineer

**Location**  
- San Francisco, CA / Remote (US-based; hub in SF, team of ~4–5) ([ycombinator.com](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/milo/jobs/myCYhHu-senior-backend-engineer?utm_source=openai))  

**Key Requirements (highlights)** ([ycombinator.com](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/milo/jobs/myCYhHu-senior-backend-engineer?utm_source=openai))  
- 4+ years backend development (they say 4+, but they’re clearly hiring at a senior level).  
- Proficient in Python and AWS (plus Supabase, Twilio).  
- Experience with distributed systems / backend services and APIs.  
- Comfortable in a very small, fast‑moving startup team; strong ownership mindset.  

**Why this might be a good fit**  
- Clear match on Python + AWS; you’d likely influence infra decisions including Docker/K8s if not already in place.  
- YC + OpenAI-backed AI consumer SaaS (family productivity copilot), so the tech and domain are modern and interesting.  
- Fully remote within US but with an SF hub, so you get Bay Area connection without mandatory relocation.

---

## 4) Dynamo AI – Senior Kubernetes Engineer

**Location**  
- San Francisco, CA / New York, NY – hybrid (2–3 days/week in office); team size ~40, SF HQ ([ycombinator.com](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/dynamo-ai/jobs/fU1oC9q-senior-kubernetes-engineer?utm_source=openai))  

**Key Requirements (highlights)** ([ycombinator.com](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/dynamo-ai/jobs/fU1oC9q-senior-kubernetes-engineer?utm_source=openai))  
- Extensive expertise in Kubernetes, Helm, and containerized app delivery.  
- Strong experience with at least one major cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP).  
- 4+ years in solutions architecture / DevOps / cloud engineering, including customer‑facing work.  
- Focus on deploying and operating secure, scalable AI clusters (Kubernetes‑based) in enterprise environments.  

**Why this might be a good fit**  
- If you want to lean harder into K8s and cloud infra, this role is highly aligned with Docker/Kubernetes/AWS strengths.  
- AI infrastructure/SaaS platform company in the ~40‑employee range – squarely within your preferred company size.  
- SF office satisfies your Bay Area preference, with the added upside of working on cutting‑edge GenAI infra.

---

## 5) fal.ai – Senior Backend Engineer

**Location**  
- San Francisco, CA (downtown; relocation support, visa sponsorship) ([fal.ai](https://fal.ai/careers/4009193009?utm_source=openai))  

**Key Requirements (highlights)** ([fal.ai](https://fal.ai/careers/4009193009?utm_source=openai))  
- 5+ years building large‑scale, fault‑tolerant distributed systems and API microservices.  
- Expert in one or more of: Python, Go, Rust.  
- Experience with Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD.  
- Experience with Kubernetes/containers is explicitly a plus; data infrastructure (Kafka, Airflow, etc.) also a plus.  

**Why this might be a good fit**  
- Strong fit if you want backend + infra work in a modern AI/SaaS context and already have Python + container/K8s background.  
- SF‑based startup, competitive compensation, and significant ownership over distributed systems architecture.  
- Good match for a senior engineer with 5–10 years who wants to work close to the infra for AI workloads.

---

### How to prioritize / next steps

If you want to optimize for:

- **Pure remote + tight stack match**: Start with **Archera**.  
- **Bay Area + direct Python/Docker/K8s/AWS usage in SaaS**: Look closely at **Alembic** and **Dynamo AI**.  
- **Very small, high‑impact YC startup with some remote flexibility**: **Milo**.  
- **Bay Area AI infra and distributed systems depth**: **fal.ai**.

If you share your resume or LinkedIn summary, I can help you tailor a short, role‑specific pitch and a concise bullet list of talking points for each of these applications.
